author: louistsai0402
content:
Do you think the following test case covers your scenario?

This [test](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/blob/28e339e9cbb94441505a598994e9d6f36b123da8/tests/benchmark/test_worst_stateful_opcodes.py#L396) performs `SLOAD` across sequential storage slots as much as possible within a single block. We also have additional tests for `BALANCE` and other stateful operations.

author: ahamlat
content: It depends if those sequential storage slots exist or not in the contract storage. If they exist, that will not cover the case I shared, if they don't exist or most of them don't exist, that will be sufficient.
